topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Working with StoreServ Backends

body.p: Once you register the StoreServ systems as per your requirements, you can use the overcloud option in the Horizon undercloud dashboard for the following tasks:

section.title: Add backend
section.note: Ensure that you allocate only those CPGs that will be used by this cloud. Changing any attributes of the CPG after allocation, may disrupt cloud functionality if the corresponding change is not updated in Sirius.

ol.li:
In the Configure Cloud page, click StoreServ Backends Tab to activate it.
Configure Cloud StoreServ Option

li.p: Click Add Backend displayed at the top to open the StoreServ Volume Backend page.
StoreServ Volume Backend Page
In the Volume Backend Name box, enter the name for the backend.
From the Available StoreServ CPG Choices box, select the CPG(s).
Click → to move the CPG(s)to the Selected StoreServ Choices box.
(Optional) Click Choose All displayed below the Available StoreServ CPG Choices box to select all the CPGs .
(Optional) Click Remove All displayed below the Selected StoreServ Choices box or select the CPG(s) and click ←to move the CPGs back to Available StoreServ Choices box.
Click Add.On successful addition of backend, the backend displays in the Backend Mapping table in the Configure Cloud page.
Backend Mapping Page
The status of the selected CPG is displayed as Reserved in the StoreServ page under the Resources Tab.
Common Provisioning Groups Page with the Reserved CPG

section.title: Expand backend
section.p: Expand backend option allocates new CPGs to an existing backend. You can select the required CPG(s) from the list of registered CPGs and add them to a backend that has been already configured.
To expand a backend, do the following:

li.p: In the Configure Cloud page, click StoreServ Backends Tab to activate it. The page displays a list of backends.
Expand Backend Option
Click Expand Backend against the backend that you want to expand. Expand StoreServ Volume Backend page is displayed.
Expand StoreServ Volume Backend Page
From the Available StoreServ CPG Choices box, select the CPG.
Click → to move the CPG(s)to the Selected StoreServ Choices box.
(Optional) Click Choose All displayed below the Available StoreServ CPG Choices box to select and move all the CPGs to the Selected StoreServ Choices box.
(Optional) Click Remove All displayed below the Selected StoreServ Choices box or select the CPG(s) and click ←to move the CPGs back to Available StoreServ Choices box.
Click Update.On successful update, the number of CPGs mapped to the backend is updated and displays in the Backend Mapping table in the Configure Cloud page.
Expanded Backend in the Backend Mapping Table

section.title: Shrink backend
section.p: This option allows you to remove the CPGs from the backend which are allocated to your cloud. To shrink the backend, do the following:

li.p: In the Configure Cloud page, click StoreServ Backends Tab to activate it. The page displays a list of backends.
Shrink Backend Option
Click More drop-down list against the Volume Backend for which you want to reduce the CPGs and select Shrink Backend. Configure StoreServ Backend page is displayed.
From the Existing StoreServ CPGs box, select the CPG.
Click → to move the CPG(s)to the Removed StoreServ CPGs box.
(Optional) Click Remove All displayed below the Existing StoreServ CPGs box to move all the CPGs to Removed StoreServ CPGs box.
(Optional) Click Select All displayed below the Removed StoreServ CPGs box or select the CPG(s) and click ←to move the CPGs back to Existing StoreServ CPGs box.
Click Update.
Shrink Backend Option
On successful update, the number of CPGs mapped to the backend is updated and displays in the Backend Mapping table in the Configure Cloud page.
Backend Mapping Table with Reduced Number of Backends

section.title: Delete backend
section.p: Before you delete the backend CPG, detach the volumes from this CPG as the backend you delete will no longer be available.
Do the following to delete a backend:

li.p: In the Configure Cloud page, click StoreServ Backends Tab to activate it. The page displays a list of backends.
Click More drop-down list against the volume backend which you want to delete and select Delete volume backend. A confirmation dialog box is displayed.
Click Delete volume backend to delete or Cancel to cancel the process.

section.title: Generate configuration
section.p: You can download the Cinder configuration relevant to HPE 3PAR StoreServ for your cloud once you create the backend.
To generate configuration file, do the following:

li.p: In the Configure Cloud page, click StoreServ Backends Tab to activate it. The page displays a list of backends.
Generate Configuration Page
Select the backend for which you want to generate the configuration file.
Click Generate Config displayed at the top of the page to display Download Storeserv Config page. The configuration file downloads automatically.
(Optional) Click Download StoreServ Config link to download the file if the file does not automatically download . A dialog box is displayed.
Click OK to download and save the file. Once you download the configuration file, you can proceed to update the overcloud configuration.

section.title: Next Steps
section.p: To use the newly added Cinder backend, create volume type and associate it with this backend using the Horizon Overcloud Dashboard or Cinder CLI.
